It's not as meaningful to get a compliment from someone who's always nice. In past seasons, you'd see people running out of the[ judging] room saying,` Simon Cowell loved me!' Simon Cowell was always the one people cared about, because he was the hardest one to get. Thompson points out that, as a British unknown looking for American fame, Simon Cowell used meanness as a savvy PR move- one that wouldn't work for Jennifer Lopez or Steven Tyler . The company said the goal of the surprise executive change, the biggest at the Web firm since Eric Schmidt joined it as CEO in 2001, is to streamline decision making and create clearer lines of responsibility and accountability at the top of the company. Co-founder Sergey Brin will focus on strategic projects, in particular new products, one of his key passions, as he said on a conference calls. 's an innovator and entrepreneur to the core, and this role suits him perfectly,'' Eric Schmidt said. ''As Google has grown, managing the business has become more complicated,'' Eric Schmidt wrote. So Larry, Sergey Brin and I have been talking for a long time how best to simplify our management structure and speed up decision making-- and over the holidays we decided now was the right moment to make some changes to the way we are structured. The news of the shake-up came just before Google announced earnings for its most recent quarter.
